entry.title: The Trillion-Dollar Club: Unstoppable Stocks and Apple's Potential Impact
entry.summary: In the world news, Apple is predicted to potentially contribute to the addition of two stocks to the prestigious $1 trillion club. Meanwhile, Meta, the parent company of Facebook, has issued an apology for removing a post by Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim, which offered condolences for the assassination of a Hamas leader. The Nikkei 225 index experienced a significant jump of almost 11% following Japan's worst stock plunge since 1987. Evergrande's liquidators are seeking to recover $6 billion from seven defendants, including founder Hui Ka Yan and his ex-wife. The mass imprisonment of rioters in England is raising concerns about the strain it will put on the country's jail system, according to a union warning. In the media industry, CNET has been sold to Ziff Davis, indicating potential future media deals. BNP Paribas is set to acquire AXA's fund business for $5.5 billion, as reported by domain-b.com. The ED (Enforcement Directorate) has filed charges against Lalu Prasad and his son Tejashwi Yadav in relation to the land-for-jobs scandal. Lastly, Quantum Capital Group is planning to acquire IPP Cogentrix from Carlyle for $3 billion, according to the American Public Power Association.
